page.title: 04DOWN HILL RACE
page.content: In Stokeinteignhead, on Spring Bank Holiday Monday there is a Downhill Race (The Fuzzy Dee) which starts at the Beacon and ends at the Church House Inn.The run is 1.5 miles long and the whole course is down hill through stoney lanes.At the Church House Inn there is a presentation for the first home Mens cup, Ladies Cup,Youngest competitor 6 to 11,and mixed 11 to 16. Later there is a pole race to the sports field and a pancake race.There are also sports managed by the sports association.On May Day there is a pram race from Stokeinteignhead to Combeinteignhead, a distance of one and a half miles, followed by a procession to Combe Village Hall where there is Morris Dancing and home baked cakes are sold. Local organisations have fund raising stalls.
